org.jsfml.window

Class Mouse

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsfml.window.Mouse

  • public final class Mouse
extends Object
    Provides access to the the real-time state of the mouse.

    The methods in this class provide direct access to the mouse state, that means that they work independently of a window's focus. In order to react to window based events, use the Window.pollEvents() method instead.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Mouse.Button
      Enumeration of supported mouse buttons.

      • isButtonPressed

        public static boolean isButtonPressed(Mouse.Button button)
        Checks if a mouse button is currently pressed.
        Parameters:
        button - the mouse button in question.
        Returns:
        true if the button is currently being pressed, false otherwise.

      • getPosition

        Retrieves the absolute position of the mouse cursor on the screen.
        Returns:

      • getPosition

        public static Vector2i getPosition(Window relativeTo)
        Retrieves the position of the mouse cursor relative to a window.
        Parameters:
        relativeTo - the window in question.
        Returns:
        the position of the mouse cursor relative to the window's top left corner.

      • setPosition

        public static void setPosition(Vector2i position)
        Sets the absolute position of the mouse cursor on the screen.
        Parameters:
        position - the new absolute position of the mouse cursor on the screen.

      • setPosition

        public static void setPosition(Vector2i position,
               Window relativeTo)
        Sets the position of the mouse cursor relative to a window.
        Parameters:
        position - the new position of the mouse cursor relative to the window's top left corner.
        relativeTo - the window in question.
